archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Shahi Paneer Korma with Saffron Rice and Oven-Puffed Poppadoms
description: A rich, nut-forward paneer korma with fragrant saffron basmati rice and crisp oven-puffed poppadoms for a celebratory Indian family feast.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until clear; drain.
Cube 500 g paneer into bite-size pieces.
Thinly slice 3 onions; mince 6 cloves garlic.
Soak 1 cup cashews in hot water for 15 minutes; drain.
Soak a pinch of saffron in 2 tablespoons warm water.
Pick and chop 1/2 cup coriander leaves.
cook_steps: Make saffron rice: Heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a pot over medium. Add 2 bay leaves and 4 cardamom pods; toast 30 seconds.

Add rinsed basmati rice; stir to coat 1 minute. Add 3 1/2 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt, and the saffron water. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 10 minutes.
Start korma base: In a wide pan, heat 2 tablespoons oil (or ghee) over medium. Add sliced onions and 1/2 teaspoon salt; cook, stirring, until deep golden, 12–15 minutes.
Add minced garlic; cook 1 minute. Stir in 4 tablespoons korma paste, 2 tablespoons korma spice blend, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, and 1 teaspoon chili flakes; fry 1–2 minutes until aromatic.
Blend the drained cashews with 1 cup milk to a smooth paste. Add to the pan along with 1 cup cream and 1/2 teaspoon sugar; whisk until smooth. Simmer gently 5 minutes, stirring.
Add paneer cubes; simmer on low 5–8 minutes to heat through. Finish with 1 teaspoon garam masala and half the chopped coriander. Adjust salt to taste.
Oven-puff poppadoms: Arrange 8 poppadoms on baking trays. Lightly brush with oil. Bake 2–3 minutes, rotating trays once, until blistered and crisp.
Fluff rice with a fork. Plate rice, spoon over shahi paneer korma, and top with remaining coriander. Serve with poppadoms and lemon wedges.
